meanings.definition: A sweet, clear, semisolid, somewhat elastic spread or preserve made from fruit juice and sugar boiled to a thick consistency.
meanings.sent1: I spread strawberry jelly on my toast in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The grape jelly was delicious with the peanut butter sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The jelly wobbled on the plate like a happy dance.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like jelly, sweet and infectious.
meanings.sent5: The jelly sparkled in the sunlight, tempting me to take a bite.

meanings.definition: A substance resembling jelly in consistency.
meanings.sent1: The gelatin dessert wiggled like jelly on the plate.
meanings.sent2: The slime felt like jelly in my hands, squishy and smooth.
meanings.sent3: The jelly-like substance oozed out of the container, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His words had a jelly-like quality, sticking to my mind long after he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The jelly consistency of the glue made it easy to spread evenly.
